content: Yes, MPAs can contribute significantly to the economy through various tourism-related services, such as recreational fishing, scuba diving, and wildlife watching. These activities can attract ecotourists from around the world, who are interested in experiencing the marine biodiversity protected by MPAs. In addition, MPAs can create sustainable jobs in fields such as tourism, scientific research, and conservation. Well-managed MPAs can also enhance the resilience of adjacent fisheries, which can provide long-term economic benefits to local communities that depend on them. So, protecting marine ecosystems can contribute to both the health of the planet and economic well-being of the people who depend on them.
